document.heading: District Government Land Use Temporary Amendment Act of 1994

history.narrative: Law 10-190, the “District Government Land Use Temporary Amendment Act of 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-688. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 5, 1994, and July 19, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on August 4, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-316 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-190 became effective on October 1, 1994.

meta.search-text: EN L MEN (S) COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D,C~ LAW lO-lgO "District Government Land Use Temporary Amendment Act of 1994 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 "the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. I0-688 on first and second readings, July 5, 1994 and July 19, 1994, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on August 4, 1994, this legislation was assigned Act No. I0-316, and published in the August 12, 1994, edition of the D.C. Register (Vol.41 page 5360) and transmitted to Congress on August 8, 1994 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(I) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C~ Law lO-190 effective October l, 1994. Dates Counted During the 30-day Congressional Review Period: August September 8,9,10,II,12,15,16,17,18,19,22,23,24,25,26 12,13,14,15,16,19,20,21,22,23,26,27,28,29,30 AN ACT D,C, ACT i0-316 Enrolled Original Codifk:=tlon District of Columbia Code 199t SuPplement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA AUGUST 4, 1994 To amend, on a temporary basis, section 7 of the District of Columbia Comprehensive Plan Act of 1984 Land Use Element Amendment Act of 1984 to exempt from zoning any use existing prior to May 23, 1990, or any use for which a notice of planned use was published in the District of Columbia Register within the 3-year period prior to May 23, 1990. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "District Government Land Use Temporary Amendment Act of 1994 See. 2. Section 7(a) of the District of Columbia Comprehensive Plan Act of 1984 Land Use Element Amendment Act of 1984, effective May 23, 1990 (D.C. Law 8-129; D.C. Code § 1-250(a is amended to read as follows The government shall be subject to zoning, except that any use of government-owned property that existed prior to May 23, 1990, and any use of government-owned property for which a notice of planned use was published in the District of Columbia Register within the 3-year period prior to May 23, 1990, shall not be subject to zoning. See. 3 a) This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, override of the veto by the Council) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Star. 813; D.C. Code § 1-233(c)(1 and publication in either the District of Columbia Register, the District of Columbia Statutes-at-Large, or the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations. Note, Section 1-250 Enrolled Original (b) This act shall expire on the 225th day of its having taken effect or upon the effective date of the District of Columbia Land Use Amendment Act of 1994, whichever occurs first.
